title: Owner initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the smart contract owner.
whitepaper: The owner of the smart contract is initially set to the account that deploys the contract. This ownership can later be transferred to another account if desired, using the `transferOwnership` function provided in the contract.
code: The owner of the smart contract is initialized to the account that deploys the contract. This is established in the constructor of the Ownable contract, where the `_transferOwnership` function is called with the deployer's address (retrieved via `_msgSender()`) as the argument.

title: Minter initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the token Minter.
whitepaper: I'm sorry, but the provided text does not contain information on how the Minter of the token is initialized. If you can provide the relevant section from the white paper, I would be happy to help with a summary.
code: The minter of the token is initialized through the `initialize` function, which is a public function with the `initializer` modifier, setting up the token's name and symbol and initializing the contract's state. This function is part of the contract's setup process and is intended to be called once to configure the token upon deployment.

title: Owner initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the smart contract owner.
whitepaper: The owner of the smart contract is initialized as the account that deploys the contract, which is set during the execution of the contract's constructor. The deployer's address is assigned to the private `_owner` variable and an `OwnershipTransferred` event is emitted to record the initialization of ownership.
code: The owner of the smart contract is initialized to the address that deploys the contract, as seen in the constructor of the `Ownable` contract where `_owner` is set to `msgSender`, which represents the deployer's address. This is established at the time of contract deployment.

title: Minter initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the token Minter.
whitepaper: The minter of the token is initialized by calling the `initialize` function, which sets up the token's name and symbol. This function is part of the contract's deployment process and is likely called only once to establish the token's basic properties.
code: The minter of the token is initialized by calling the `initialize` function, which sets the token's name and symbol. This function is part of a one-time initialization process that is likely to be called by a factory contract or deployment script, as indicated by the `initializer` modifier and the context of the code.
